section.title: ThroughputStatsReporter
section.para: The reporter is able to report the statistics - current, minimal, maximal and average value of a throughput (in the means of the number of iterations per second) from the beginning of the measuring to the moment when the results are published (default) or in a specified window. The default result of this reporter is the current throughput.

row.entry: Enables measuring of total size of requests sent.
Enables measuring of total size of responses received.
A window where the data for the statistics are taken from. The value unit depends on the window type specified by the windowType property.
A type of the window. It is either number of last iterations of an amount of time in milliseconds. The values of iteration or time is supported.
A comma separated list of values where the histogram is split to individual ranges.
String prefix used in the result map for histogram entries. This prefix is followed by the mathematical representation of the particular range.

section.para: The following table describes result names of ThroughputStatsReporter:

row.entry: The current throughput in iterations/s - of the latest iteration.
The minimal throughput in iterations/s measured so far (in a given time window).
The minimal throughput in iterations/s measured so far (in a given time window).
The average throughput in iterations/s measured so far (in a given time window).
The size of all requests sent so far (in a given sliding window).
The size of all responses received so far (in a given sliding window).
If histogram is used, there is a result with the value of histogram for each range. Example: in<100.0:200.0) for a value range between 100.0 and 200.0 and the histogramPrefix set to "in".

example.title: An example of ThroughputStatsReporter configuration with a sliding window over last 30 iterations
example.programlisting: <reporter class="ThroughputStatsReporter"> <property name="minimumEnabled" value="false"/> <property name="maximumEnabled" value="false"/> <property name="windowSize" value="30"/> ... (destinations) ... </reporter>

section.para: In the example above there is a ThroughputStatsReporter configured to report the current and the average value of the throughput in a sliding window of 30 iterations.
